With the new definition, the frequency, duration, and severity of flash drought events are calculated similar to those of conventional drought events
25 , but at a higher temporal resolution. During a study period, the frequency is defined as the average number of flash drought events during the growing seasons per year, the mean duration is the average number of days during which an event lasts, and the mean severity is the mean accumulated soil moisture percentile deficits from the threshold of 40%. There is a higher chance for flash droughts over southern China (humid region) than over northern China (semiarid region), according to both the new and old definitions (Fig. 2a, b). There are more flash drought events based on the old definition (Fig. 2b), but their corresponding mean durations are very short, mostly around 7 days (Fig. 2d). In contrast, the mean durations of flash drought events based on the new definition are about 20–40 days (Fig. 2c), which is more reasonable in terms of drought impact
16 .
